filesystem
Class Directory

java.lang.Object
  filesystem.FileSystemItem
      filesystem.Directory

public class Directory
extends FileSystemItem

This class implements the behavior of concrete directories. Composite-Pattern: Composite

Responsibilities:

  • defines behavior for components (directories) having children.
  • stores child components (files and subdirectories).
  • implements child-related operations in the Component interface. These are:
    - getContent()
    - add(Directory), add(File)
    - getNumberOfFiles(), getNumberOfDirectories()

    Directory

    public Directory(java.lang.String name)
    Constructor.

    Parameters:
    name - Name of the new directory. May not contain any ':', '/', ',', ' ' or '\' in the name. Otherwise, the name is not changed and an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
    Method Detail

    isDirectory

    public boolean isDirectory()
    true is returned.

    Specified by:
    isDirectory in class FileSystemItem
    Returns:
    - true this item is a directory - false this item is not a directory

    getContent

    public java.util.ArrayList<FileSystemItem> getContent()
    An array list with the content of this directory (files and subdirectories) is returned. The returned list may not be changed, only read access is allowed.

    Specified by:
    getContent in class FileSystemItem
    Returns:
    - the list of contained files and directories if isDirectory() - null if isDirectory() == false

    add

    public void add(Directory subDir)
    Adds a new subdirectory to this directory. If the directory to add is already part of another directory structure, it is removed from there.

    Parameters:
    subDir - Object of the directory to be added.

    add

    public void add(File file)
    Adds a new file to this directory. If the file to add is already part of another directory structure, it is removed from there.

    Parameters:
    file - Object of the file to be added.

    remove

    public void remove(FileSystemItem item)
    Removes a directory or a file from current directory. Sets the parent of the removed item to null, if contained in this directory.

    Parameters:
    item - Directory or file to be removed from this directory. If item is not part of this directory, nothing happens. Note: If you need to remove the entire content, you cannot use an iterator since you change the list, the iterator is enumerating. Use this code instead: while(root.getContent().size() > 0) { root.remove(root.getContent().get(0)); }

    getNumberOfFiles

    public int getNumberOfFiles()
    Returns the number of files in this directory. Does not count number of files in the subdirectories.

    Specified by:
    getNumberOfFiles in class FileSystemItem
    Returns:
    number of contained files if isDirectory() 0 if isDirectory() == false

    getNumberOfDirectories

    public int getNumberOfDirectories()
    Description copied from class: FileSystemItem

    Specified by:

    Returns:

    getSize

    public int getSize()
    Returns 0 since directories have no size.

    Specified by:
    getSize in class FileSystemItem
    Returns:
    the size in bytes of the file (string length of the content) if isDirectory() == false 0 if isDirectory()
